author: Staff Reporter
text:
Almost all of the nearly 3000 students of Bharathidasan Government College for Women participated in the festivities

Using the celebration of ‘Samuthva Pongal’ as a platform for unity, students and staff of the Bharathidasan Government College for Women ushered in the festivities on Wednesday.

With everyone turning out in their best traditional attire, the mood was one of joy and rediscovering traditional customs. “This is the first time Pongal is being celebrated on campus like this. The festival is the epitome of Tamil culture. We thought we should start with the college as far as respect for all religions are concerned,” said Principal S.K. Dash.

Rituals like drawing kolam and singing of traditional songs were followed, said S. Alamelu Mangai, Assistant Professor, Post Graduate and Research Department of Home Science. The students and staff cooked not only ven pongal and sweet pongal but also millets pongal, signifying a renewed interest in the cereal crop. Nearly 3000 students participated in the festivities. Students Sugitha and Dhanalakshmi welcomed the idea of Pongal on campus and said more festivals should be celebrated in the college.
title: Students, staff celebrate Pongal on campus
